page.title: 12LIFE AS AN IMMIGRANT
page.content: {*** Interviewed by local children *** This Asian family (man,wife and 2 year old daughter) had recently moved to England from Australia, where the man had found difficulty in obtaining work in engineering, due to a bias towards native Australians. The family had no complaint about the house and found the neighbours to be friendly and helpful. They did not like the amount of broken glass in the streets, nor the lack of phone boxes (they had had their own phone fitted to keep family contacts). They did not find the local shops attractive or suiting their needs and they did not use the bus services because they had their own car. They found the neighbourhood to be quiet and traffic free (just as they liked it) and were quite happy and well settled in the area.
